Definition at line 9 of file eol_dialog.c.

eolWindow* eol_dialog_text_prompt ( char *  output,
eolUint  bufferSize,
eolUint  lineWidth,
eolLine  question,
void *  customData,
eolWindowCallback  onOk,
eolWindowCallback  onCancel 
)

pops up a text entry dialog. output buffer is not touched unless user presses enter.

To provide common window dialogs useful for any game or editor

Parameters:
output This is where the output will be written upon completion. Buffer must survive the dialog box
bufferSize this is the character limit for the output buffer.
lineWidth this how many characters per line will be drawn. if 0, there is no limit
question this is the text that is shown to the user to phrase the input
customData this is up the user. This will be passed to the callback upon completion
onOk if specified this will be called (and bassed customData) if the user hits OK
onCancel if specified this will be called (and bassed customData) if the user hits CANCEL
Returns:
a pointer to the window created. If output cannot wait for the dialog to complete, the dialog should be destroyed.

Definition at line 227 of file eol_dialog.c.

void eol_dialog_yes_no ( eolLine  question,
void *  customData,
eolWindowCallback  onYes,
eolWindowCallback  onNo 
)

pops up a yes / no window dialog.

Parameters:
question the text to show in the dialog box
customData if the callbacks need to work on custom data, it can be passed though this pointer
onYes the window callback to call when the YES option is selected
onNo the window callback to call when the NO option is selected
